title: Helensburgh Tigers
text:
The Helensburgh Tigers are an <a href="Australia">Australia</a>n <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> football team based in <a href="Helensburgh%2C%20New%20South%20Wales">Helensburgh</a>, a country town of the <a href="Illawarra">Illawarra</a> region. The club are a part of <a href="Country%20Rugby%20League">Country Rugby League</a> and has competed in the <a href="Illawarra%20Rugby%20League">Illawarra Rugby League</a> premiership since its inception in 1911.
History.
The Tigers are a foundation club of the <a href="Illawarra%20Rugby%20League">Illawarra Rugby League</a>, playing in the inaugural competition in 1911. Their first game was a 2-0 defeat to Wollongong. The club, however, didn't always compete in first grade since this time and not always did they have a reserve grade team following them. Scarborough fielded a reserves team which followed the Tigers between 1932 and 1935 before the Tigers dropped out of first grade (leaving Scarborough to field a reserves side behind Albion Park) in 1936.
Name and emblem.
The Helensburgh team is represented by a tiger, and their emblem is similar to that of the old <a href="NSWRL">NSWRL</a> team <a href="Balmain%20Tigers">Balmain Tigers</a> (before they merged with <a href="Western%20Suburbs%20Magpies">Wests</a>).
Colours.
Their colours, gold and black, are also similar to the old Balmain Tigers side.
Women's team.
The <a href="Helensburgh%20Tiger%20Lillies">Helensburgh Tiger Lillies</a> was founded in 2005 Helensburgh Tiger Lilies Women's Rugby League Club are an Australian professional <a href="Women%27s%20rugby%20league">Women's rugby league</a> football team based in <a href="Helensburgh%2C%20New%20South%20Wales">Helensburgh, New South Wales</a>.
